creator: nicole.allard
title: EL Wire Cube Sculpture
materials_required: 5 colors of el wire, each color is a single strand approximately 8ft, each color forms a "band" of parallel strands, 10 strands wide, each strand is 2.2mm thick
12 VDC EL Wire inverter capable of lighting 27-40 ft
description: This project is about creating a cube sculpture with EL wire running through channels in the edges of the cube. The EL wire is powered by an inverter and the entire assembly is housed in a steel cube structure.
steps: Design the location of the wires in a 3D modeling program to ensure no color bands collide.
Face the steel plate on a manual mill and hollow out a pocket in the bottom using a CNC tormach, leaving raised corners for an acrylic plate.
Drill and tap holes in the raised corners of the pocket for mounting the acrylic plate.
Cut the square tubing for the cube edges: 4 bars at 7" with 45-degree angles and 4 bars at 5.5" with straight cuts.
Mill channels for the EL wire to run through, ensuring the channel 'teeth' face the pulling direction, and drill holes in the base.
Tack weld the posts to the base, ensuring they are straight and square, then tack weld the top square together.
Clamp and tack weld the top square to the posts, ensuring a square shape.
Fully weld all the joints and smooth out the welds and round the corners using an angle grinder.
Powder coat the cube matte black.
Solder connectors to the EL wire.
String the EL wires through the holes in the base and channels in the cube edges, forming U shapes and catching them on the milled 'teeth'.
Use toothpicks as shims on the underside of the cube to pull the wire taut.
Bundle the ends of the wire strands with plastic ties and apply epoxy to the exposed wire on the bottom of the cube.
Cut the clear acrylic plate, create the screw holes, the hole for the power cord, and etch the surface with a laser cutter.
Bundle all the wires into the pocket in the base and secure the acrylic plate with screws.
